title: Two to Foxtrot
description: Creating a 2 player co-op platformer puzzle game using Unity and XBox controllers. The unique part of this game is that the two players each see different details of the game world, and communication is encouraged to solve the puzzles. I was the main programmer, working on the player system, input integration, and puzzle mechanics, along with another programmer working on UI and game manager, and a 3D artist and a 2D artist/sound designer within 2.5 week.

title: Little Match Girl MR Experience
description: A visual storytelling experience where players traverse through the real and virtual worlds through interacting with live actors in passthrough mode and having a sense of freedom in the virtual world. I was in charge of audio design, and integrated FMOD which I self-learned in 2 days.

title: Breathe Deep
description: A submission for the Global Game Jam Pittsburgh, themed Bubble, and won Jammer's Award. I worked on the bubble mechanics as well as FMOD integration and some audio design. I worked closely with 2 other programmers, 2 artists, and a sound designer.

title: Minijava Compiler
description: Developed a compiler for MiniJava, a subset of Java, using Java. Implemented lexical analysis using Jflex, syntax parsing using CUP tools, and Abstract Syntax Tree traversial for type checking, and code generation in x86 assembly language.

title: Python Pacman Pathfinding AI
description: Implemented AI algorithms such as BFS, DFS, A* for pathfinding and decision-making in a Pacman environment.

title: Spelunx - CAVERN Toolkit
description: Implemented AI algorithms such as BFS, DFS, A* for pathfinding and decision-making in a Pacman environment.
category: CS and Code, People and Research
